text: (upbeat inspirational music)

♪ When I was young I couldn't
wait to see the world ♪
♪ See everything and ♪

- [Dallin] My favorite
toy as a little kid was,
I had this blue CD player stereo.

I loved to bring the
stereo into the bathroom,
and sing Marvin Gaye, loud as I could.
I've had a lot of different jobs.

I worked at the blueberry
fields, and I deweeded onions.
I worked on a farm
♪ I seen lights in New York City ♪

♪ Been around the world,
and I know it's pretty ♪

♪ But, you know, I couldn't wait
to get back to my hometown. ♪
- [Dallin] Amazon was pitching

a data center technician,
kind of, bootcamp.

It sounded like a great
opportunity, and I figured,
"you know, might as well give it a shot."

♪ Learned a little 'bout love,
and a little 'bout life ♪

♪ And I got a good job,
and I met my wife ♪
♪ And I settled down off in my hometown ♪
(harmonica)
(gentle music)
- [Tasha] Being a single mom,
you go where the money is.

I was working security, and
before that was a lumber yard.
I've also been a dental assistant,
and worked in old folks homes.

I love fixing things, and
I love learning new things,

but I didn't have any
technical background.

I wanted to prove to myself
that I could do any job
that I set my mind to.

Now, did I know that I would
be as lucky to get this job?
Absolutely not, but I knew I could do it.
(country strumming)
- [Fidel] My journey at AWS,

started straight outta
Hermiston High School.

I wanted to do a trade,
like a diesel mechanic.

One of the options was the
data center technicians program

that was offered at BMCC,
which is our local college.

Ms. Monroe, she's the counselor
for Hermiston High School.
She mentioned this program to me,
and she helped me get in.
- My job was do to mentor students.
I was the one that you met with.

Did you know about the
data center technician?

- No, you're the one
that told me about it,
and the funny part is, like,

as soon as you told me
about it, I was like,
"okay, that's it."
♪ I've been waiting for a long time ♪
♪ Been search for my own kind ♪
- [Dallin] I came into AWS

as what's called a Rack
Install Technician.
So, all the logical and physical ingestion

of the computing equipment,
getting that online.
Eventually I was able to get into
the manager-in-training program.
(guitar strums)
Being able to create music is awesome.

It gives me a feeling that
I don't get anywhere else.
I don't get too emotional very often,
but music can really touch a part of me.

I'm glad that I don't have to
make a living off of music,
because it's something that I really love,

and I don't have to stress
about it becoming work.
(humming melodically)
- [Tasha] What I love best about my job

is the opportunities that
I get, learning new things.

in the morning, we see how
many racks were coming in.
We sit there and put on all the whips,

we walk our whole building, we
check everything for alarms,

make sure everything is
working the way it should,
and then we go into the red zone.

- [Fidel] One of the
most surprising things

about working for Amazon, is
you just don't really know
what's gonna happen next.
All of a sudden it's like,

"oh hey, there's a new
type of rack that came in,"

and then you have to
learn all the technology
that's in that one,
and you gotta be ready to troubleshoot it.

- [Tasha] I really like
when something breaks,

when we get to actually
take it apart and fix it.

That's the most exciting
part of my job, I think.

- So, normally the birria is
supposed to be in the stew,

but the queso birrias
are, they're pretty good.
So, I like cooking them that way, instead.
I work with my brother.
Fidel kind of pushed me to look into DCO.

I've enjoyed it. There's
a lot of technicality,

and you know, it's just
a lot to learn every day

And, obviously working with
this big head over here, so.
(gentle music)

- [Fidel] Before, there weren't
a ton of options around here

because there wasn't that
growth, and it's allowing people

to stay, you know, close to
their family, close to home.

- [Tasha] I don't have to
stress as much about bills.

I don't have to live in a
low income housing anymore.
I'm able to take my kids to the ocean,
kick back and watch a movie.

- [Fidel] I like the people I
work with. I like my position.
I like what I do.
(country rock music)
- [Dallin] I wake up every morning,
and I feel good about going to work.
- It makes me excited to see,

'cause I can tell it's what
you were supposed to do.
- Yeah, that's what it feels like.
♪ So if you like pints and simple livin' ♪
♪ Why don't you see what you and me got ♪
♪ And ill be waiting in my hometown ♪
(harmonica and guitar strumming)
(audience claps)
- Thank y'all so much.
Ain't it such a nice place to live.
